shortDescription: ESLint Smart Exclusions - Enterprise i18n Configuration
problem: ESLint no-hardcoded-strings rule was too aggressive, flagging import paths, console logs, CSS classes, and Next.js directives
cause: Rule didn't distinguish between user-facing strings and technical code

solution.phase3: Added isInConsoleCall() to skip debug messages
solution.phase4: Added isTechnicalString() for paths, URLs, IDs, CSS classes
solution.phase5: Added exclusion paths for non-user-facing code

ruleEnhancements: Skip module paths, URLs, MIME types, HTTP methods

verification.eslintRuns: Rule no longer flags technical strings
verification.remainingErrors: Legitimate i18n warnings for Greek text in UI
verification.typeScriptCheck: Pre-existing errors in packages/core/ unrelated to this change

notes: Τα εναπομείναντα ESLint errors είναι σωστά i18n warnings για ελληνικό κείμενο που χρειάζεται διεθνοποίηση. Αυτό είναι η σωστή συμπεριφορά.
commits: 2c1ba06 - fix(eslint): add smart exclusions for no-hardcoded-strings rule
